Posts.Content: Melissa_N wrote: Hi, I am a 29 yo female with no family history of breast cancer.  Three months ago I noticed a lump under my right armpit. It is in the crease where your arm bends.  I had just had major weight loss surgery when I noticed it and thought it was from the surgery or deoderent or something. I honestly forgot about it.  Two weeks ago I "found it again" and decided to see the my PCP.  She did a breast exam and said my breast are lumpy and then examined the enlarged lymph node.  There is no pain, it is hard and fixed in place.  She said she wanted me to go ahead and have it biopsied since it has been there for 3 months.  She is also having me get a sono of my right breast.  She didn't think they will let me have a mammo at my age.  I have the sono established for Friday and I see the surgeon the same day.  I don't know if he will be doing the biopsy or not. I am scared and don't know what to expect or when the result will be in.  So it may be a couple of weeks before I get an answer. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hello..new with upcoming testing. Melissa_N Shirlann

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2008 12:10AM Melissa_N wrote: Thank you for your reply!  I am very thankful for my PCP.  She is very pro-active and listens to your concearns.  She is very on top of your medical history or conditions and has a very pro-active stance on everything.  I am keeping positive that the enlarge lymph node in nothing and everything will be OK!
Posts.Title: Hello..new with upcoming testing. Melissa_N Shirlann
